title: Druid
intro: A healer’s faith twisted into something rooted and wrong.

plot.introduction: The druid laid languidly in bed as a crowd of friends and family gathered around him: the illness afflicting him, contracted while he was outside the village, was the strangest the healers had ever seen.

story.html:
The exhausted adventurers, worn from recent battles, tread heavily through the dense forest, as rain soaks their clothes and turns the ground beneath them into a hungry sludge. About halfway between the entrance and the exit of the forest, they notice something unusual: a short distance away, a man sits on the ground with his back against a tree trunk, writhing in terrible spasms.

As they draw closer, the adventurers begin to notice disturbing details: the man is covered head-to-toe in scratches and smeared with blood, especially around his head, where the wounds are so deep and numerous that they look like a tangled web of threads. It seems he is unable to perceive any sound, ignoring all the adventurers’ questions.

The adventurers decide to bring the man to a nearby village. The healers recognize him as Mirad, a respected druid. Soon after, horrifying screams come from his chamber—tiny aberrant creatures pour out of the druid’s orifices as he writhes in agony.

The healers in the village immediately begin examining him to determine the cause of his affliction and the best treatment, while Mirad’s wife and children, notified of the situation, rush to the scene and insist on entering the room where he is under observation.

At the beginning of this adventure, the characters are waiting outside the room where the healers, along with Mirad’s family, are tending to him, hoping for news of his condition. However, the relative calm is shattered by the horrified screams of everyone at his bedside. The adventurers burst into the room to see a grotesque and macabre scene unfolding before them: a swarm of tiny, aberrant creatures are pouring out of the druid’s orifices as he writhes in agony, blood streaming down his face.

acts.title: 1. Fight or Flee
acts.description:
The creatures begin to swarm around the people in the room. Each time one of them touches someone, it leaves a scratch or tears off a small piece of flesh. The swarm is so vast that, if left to their fate, all NPCs would be devoured in seconds and reduced to a bloody pulp.

The characters must find a way to escape the room while saving as many people as possible. Use the following clocks to manage the escape progress.

Adventurers’ Clock (white, 3 segments). Whenever the characters succeed in fleeing, rescuing a victim from the demons, or eliminating a large portion of demons, advance one segment.

Enemies’ Clock (black, 3 segments). Every round, advance one segment. Whenever you advance one segment, modify the scenario according to the plot described in the corresponding segment description.

Hard Mode. All creatures (excluding the aberrant creatures) in the room take 1/3 of their maximum Hit Points as Necrotic damage at the beginning of each round.

Brutal Mode. Instead of progressing the Enemies’ Clock every round, progress it every turn.

entries.summary: Think Quickly. The characters must choose between fleeing and trying to save the people in the room.
Kill Them With Fire. Someone throws a lantern; flames incinerate some aberrations.
Unorthodox Methods. A heavy piece of furniture collapses, crushing dozens of aberrations.
A Mage’s Help. A wizard casts a Globe of Invulnerability to shield the wounded.
The swarm thickens and grows bolder.
The air becomes toxic with spores.
When full, all NPCs die and the aberrations flee.

modes.text: All creatures (excluding the aberrant ones) take 1/3 of their maximum HP as necrotic damage each round.
Advance the Enemies’ Clock every turn instead of every round.

acts.title: 2. The Curse
acts.description: As the creatures flee, they cast a curse over the entire village. The characters must find them before the curse exterminates everyone.

entries.summary: Strange Sensation. The buzzing of the swarm still echoes in survivors’ ears.
Going East. The characters pursue the creatures into the forest.
A House in the Woods. They find a wounded man mourning his family.
The Mountain. The party meets dwarves who offer to guide them east.
The Ruins. The adventurers find the hive-like nest in corrupted ruins.
Curse, Stage 1. Victims weaken and develop cysts.
Curse, Stage 2. Victims cannot sleep; parasites feed within.
Curse, Final Stage. Victims burst, releasing creatures.

modes.text: The curse isn’t immediately recognized; requires investigation or magic to identify.
Apply the Brutal Effects listed for each curse stage.

ending.title: Ending
ending.html: With the destruction of the corrupted tree, the curse is lifted. However, the consequences depend on how long it took the heroes to act. Dozens of villagers may have perished, or the corruption may still spread elsewhere.
